subject: Re: [junit] Create a dynamic suite of tests
msgSnippet: ... You would need to build your own test runner for this. The standard JUnit test runners assume that the test suite is completely specified before it runs
messageBody:
choc_mah wrote:
>
>
> Ok , i hope someone can help me out
>
> it's possible to create a dynamic suite of tests using JUnit
>
> ex:
> start test
> Test 1
> If faillure or error found - run Test 1
> Test 2
> If faillure or error found - run Test 1
> Test 3
> ...
> generate a rapport
>
>
> i tried to use a testlistener, but i really dont know if its the
> right thing to use, any exemple??

You would need to build your own test runner for this. The standard
JUnit test runners assume that the test suite is completely specified
before it runs the first test.
